page.title: 13Sheep Farming
page.content: The farm at Cockles Green is called Field Farm. It has sheep, dogs and horses. The owner is Mr Oram who lives in the farm. He feeds the sheep, cuts the corn, wheatand barley with Mr Oram's combine-harvester and, when they have finished, they put all the different grains into big bins until they sell them to make different kinds of food, like Weetabix, for instance. They keep the left-overs, that is the straw bits on the field so, when the bailer comes along, it turns them into round bails as quickly as anything. If the by-pass goes through Mr Oram's land it will be cut in half, so, to get his sheep over to the other side of the road, they'll have a little bridge across the by-pass. Joanne Lincoln
